title: The ambiguities of the 'Generation Z' movement in Mexico
subhead: Driven by a billionaire at odds with Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum's government, a movement calling itself 'Generation Z' brought tens of thousands of people together for a protest against insecurity and corruption on November 15 in Mexico City, ending in violent clashes with the police.

title: Sex, lies and bicycles: Espionage scandal rocks Denmark
subhead: The head of the Danish intelligence services allegedly provided false information to political leaders in the Kingdom of Denmark to justify placing the director of military intelligence under surveillance for nearly a year.

title: A stroll through Cachan: From a royal aqueduct to a panoramic garden
subhead: The town of Val-de-Marne, traversed by a monumental aqueduct since the 17th century, offers a rewarding detour from the RER commuter train, with a beautiful Art Deco belfry crowning its city hall, an artists' hamlet, gourmet arcades, organic vineyards and green spaces to explore by bike.

title: The fall of Northvolt, Sweden's symbol of green reindustrialization
subhead: On March 12, the electric battery giant shut its doors for good. Nearly 5,000 people employed at the Skelleftea gigafactory lost their jobs. As the US-based company Lyten prepares to restart production, Northvolt's downfall has cast a chill over Sweden's ambitions to reindustrialize around clean technology.

'He looked me up and down': Hostesses, flight attendants and waitresses speak out about everyday sexualization
subhead: Crude jokes, inappropriate stares and overt flirting are commonplace for women in service jobs where physical appearance is paramount. Employees remain poorly protected from this sexualization, which can amount to harassment.

title: The 'everlasting peace' in Gaza promised by Trump is off to a troubled start
subhead: The US president described the UN Security Council's vote on phase II of his peace plan as the dawn 'a golden age for the Middle East.' But how can we separate this bluster from actual reality, asks Le Monde columnist Alain Frachon.

title: The MAGA world, divided over Trump's politics and eaten away by neo-Nazi movement
subhead: The Epstein case, tech billionaires, Venezuela, Israel: The movement that brought Donald Trump back to the White House now finds itself splintered on numerous fronts.  An openly antisemitic, racist and misogynistic current is gaining ground around Nick Fuentes.
